text:
The only time I see it come up is when someone gets extremely confused from a typo or something like above. Another classic one is when you mess up your pasting:

```julia> julia> x = 3; # set x to 3

julia> 5 > 2 # do some math
3```

elements.text: The only time I see it come up is when someone gets extremely confused from a typo or something like above. Another classic one is when you mess up your pasting:

julia> julia> x = 3; # set x to 3

julia> 5 > 2 # do some math
3
Can we require a space?

text: I thought that the `julia>` was automatically removed?  Maybe that doesn’t happen on all platforms?  (It works on a Mac)

elements.text: I thought that the
julia>
was automatically removed?  Maybe that doesn’t happen on all platforms?  (It works on a Mac)

text: <@U69KQT9DL> On Windows, `julia>` is not automatically removed

elements.text: On Windows,
julia>
is not automatically removed

text:
Ah, okay.  <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/stdlib/REPL/#The-Julian-mode|From the docs>:
> This feature does not work on the standard Windows command prompt due to its limitation at detecting when a paste occurs.

elements.text: Ah, okay.
From the docs
This feature does not work on the standard Windows command prompt due to its limitation at detecting when a paste occurs.

text: It seems there should be a hacky way to do this (e.g., detect that “julia>” was typed in less than `0.0000001` seconds at the beginning of the prompt…)

elements.text: It seems there should be a hacky way to do this (e.g., detect that “julia>” was typed in less than
seconds at the beginning of the prompt…)

text: Maybe it is coming to Windows soon: <https://github.com/microsoft/terminal/pull/9034>

elements.text: Maybe it is coming to Windows soon:

text: I wonder if we could default Julia to use Windows Terminal is installed in the future.

elements.text: I wonder if we could default Julia to use Windows Terminal is installed in the future.

text: I proposed to reserve `julia` as keyword to make this impossible but it has received no love

julia> 5 > 2 # do some math
3```
